required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predictive Multimodal Signatures Associated With Response to Treatment and Prognosis of Patients With Stage IV Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Deep Learning-Enabled Exploration of Predictive Signatures in a Multicenter Retrospective and Prospective Observational Study Allowing the Analysis of the Aggregation of Multimodal Clinical, Biological, Genomic and Radiomics Data Associated With the Response to Treatment and Prognosis of Patients With Stage IV Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Predicting response to therapy and disease progression in stage IV NSCLC patients treated with pembrolizumab monotherapy, chemotherapy-pembrolizumab combination therapy or chemotherapy alone in the first-line setting.

primary_outcome.description: Predict treatment response at first evaluation using baseline data

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, expected 6-14 months contingent on cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Predict Progression-Free Survival (PFS) using data at baseline and first evaluation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, expected 8-20 months contingent on cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Predict Overall Survival (OS) using data at baseline and first evaluation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, expected 6-14 months contingent on cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Predict Duration of Response (DoR) using data at baseline and first evaluation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, expected 6-14 months contingent on cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Predict Time-To-Progression (TTP) using data at baseline and first evaluation

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients diagnosed with stage IV NSCLC (de novo or earlier stage progression to stage IV), without oncogene-activating mutations eligible for targeted therapy, that are treated in the first-line setting with either pembrolizumab monotherapy, chemotherapy and pembrolizumab combination therapy, or chemotherapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult â‰¥18 years old
- Patient diagnosed with Stage IV NSCLC (de novo or earlier stage progression to stage IV)
- Absence of oncogene activating mutations eligible patients to targeted therapy (EGFR, ALK)
- Cohort A: Received first line treatment with pembrolizumab monotherapy
- Cohort B: Received first line treatment with chemotherapy and pembrolizumab combination therapy
- Cohort C: Received first line treatment with chemotherapy doublet
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior anti-cancer therapy for actual stage IV NSCLC
- Critical data missing (e.g., PD-L1 status, baseline millimetric imaging, first evaluation millimetric imaging)
- Patients participating in other clinical trials that modify the standard of care
